page.title: 11Industry_continued
page.content: The catchment area for the reservoir is approximately one thousand acres, but with only two feeder streams and two drains,it is considered by the Water Authority to be a rather poor one.When full the surface area of the reservoir is forty two acres and four hundred and twenty million gallons of water or ninety days supply would then be contained.There are considered to be three layers of water within the reservoir;these being determined by depth below the surface level.The top or transit layer is the cleanest and contains the most aquatic life.This is followed by a middle layer which contains less life and below that,at the bottom,is the dirtiest stagnant layer,the habitat of blood worms. There are two outlets in the dam, one at thirty feet below the surface and the other at eighty five feet.
